0ba383d2-307d-457f-9dc7-5914afb0d970.title: MCP Memory Server Project Overview
0ba383d2-307d-457f-9dc7-5914afb0d970.content:
# MCP Memory Server Project Overview

The MCP Memory Server is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server designed to provide structured memory management across chat sessions for all MCP-enabled tools and applications. It is specifically built for project-based work, allowing memories to be stored within project directories.

Key Features:
- **Project-Specific Memory**: Stores memories locally within the project.
- **Flexible Configuration**: Supports `.mcp-memory.json` (hidden) or `mcp-memory.json` (visible).
- **Multi-Tool Support**: Compatible with Claude Desktop, Cursor, Windsurf, Cline, and more.
- **Git Integration**: Enables sharing of project memories via version control.
- **Structured Storage**: Organizes data into entities, concepts, and sessions.

The project uses `npm` for package management and includes comprehensive documentation in the `docs/` folder.

92bf43ab-8a3a-4010-995e-0b760ecd76f6.title: Eventos Finais Project
92bf43ab-8a3a-4010-995e-0b760ecd76f6.content:
# Eventos Finais Project

Eventos Finais Project Entity - A React TypeScript PWA for Bible study with offline-first SQLite database, Kinde authentication, and modern glassmorphism UI. Located at /Users/griiettner/Projects/personal/eventos-finais

355ecf4f-81e5-489e-8384-02419cfeb316.title: Technology Stack & Dependencies
355ecf4f-81e5-489e-8384-02419cfeb316.content:
# Technology Stack & Dependencies

Tech stack includes React 19 with TypeScript, Vite (Rolldown) for fast builds, React Router v6 for routing, SQLite WASM for local database, Kinde Auth for OAuth, Framer Motion for animations, and Vite PWA plugin for offline capabilities. The app uses CSS-in-JS with glassmorphism design, Lucide React icons, and ESLint for code quality. SQLite runs in Web Worker with OPFS persistence for non-blocking operations.

37d7d383-497d-4290-b101-a0e20d5baf1d.title: Eventos Finais - Project Overview
37d7d383-497d-4290-b101-a0e20d5baf1d.content:
# Eventos Finais - Project Overview

Eventos Finais is a Progressive Web Application (PWA) for interactive Bible study focused on end-times events. Built with React 19, TypeScript, and Vite, it features offline-first architecture with SQLite WASM for local data storage, Kinde OAuth authentication, and modern glassmorphism UI with Framer Motion animations. The app serves Portuguese-speaking users with 20 chapters of study content, audio playback, progress tracking, and sync capabilities.

3bd72f6f-84bf-4d9c-a776-d83a26f4573b.title: Application Architecture & Design Patterns
3bd72f6f-84bf-4d9c-a776-d83a26f4573b.content:
# Application Architecture & Design Patterns

The application follows a layered architecture: React UI layer with protected routes, AuthContext for state management, DBService facade for SQLite operations, and Web Worker for non-blocking database queries. Key patterns include Provider pattern for auth, Facade pattern for database access, and offline-first design with sync capabilities. Data flows from user interactions through components to local SQLite storage, with optional server sync when online.

53040995-6f0d-4a4b-9dbb-8cc3a8703bba.title: Eventos Finais Project Overview
53040995-6f0d-4a4b-9dbb-8cc3a8703bba.content:
# Eventos Finais Project Overview

# Eventos Finais Project Overview

Eventos Finais is a Progressive Web Application (PWA) for interactive Bible study focused on end-times events. Built with React 19, TypeScript, and Vite, it features offline-first architecture with SQLite WASM for local data storage, Kinde OAuth authentication, and modern glassmorphism UI with Framer Motion animations.

## Key Features
- Offline-first PWA with SQLite WASM database
- Kinde OAuth authentication (Google, Facebook, Apple SSO)
- 20 chapters of study content with audio playback
- Interactive questions and progress tracking
- Admin dashboard for content management
- Modern glassmorphism UI design
- Portuguese language support

## Technology Stack
- **Frontend**: React 19, TypeScript, Vite
- **Database**: SQLite WASM with Web Worker
- **Authentication**: Kinde OAuth
- **UI**: CSS-in-JS with glassmorphism, Framer Motion
- **Icons**: Lucide React
- **PWA**: Vite PWA plugin
- **State Management**: React Context API

## Project Structure
- `src/pages/` - Main application pages (LandingPage, Dashboard, ChapterDetail, AdminDashboard)
- `src/contexts/` - Authentication and state management
- `src/db/` - SQLite database service and worker
- `src/services/` - Business logic (AdminService)
- `src/components/` - Reusable UI components
- `src/data/` - Static data and interfaces
- `src/hooks/` - Custom React hooks

## Database Schema
- `chapters` - Study chapters with content and audio
- `questions` - Chapter-specific study questions
- `user_answers` - User responses to questions
- `progress` - Reading and audio progress tracking
- `user_profile` - User information and admin status

## Authentication Flow
- Uses Kinde OAuth with social providers
- Supports Apple, Google, Facebook sign-in
- Admin access controlled by Kinde roles
- Custom authentication pages for seamless UX

## Admin Features
- Chapter management (create, edit, delete)
- Audio file upload and management
- Question management system
- Role-based access control via Kinde

## Development Notes
- Offline-first architecture with sync capabilities
- Database operations run in Web Worker for performance
- Responsive design works on all devices
- Progressive Web App with install capability

9f944a9a-e659-4126-8038-47d07c6d409d.title: Project Structure & Key Components
9f944a9a-e659-4126-8038-47d07c6d409d.content:
# Project Structure & Key Components

Project directory structure: src/components/ (SyncManager), src/contexts/ (AuthContext, AuthContextCore), src/data/ (chapters), src/db/ (db-service, db-worker), src/hooks/ (useAuth), src/pages/ (LandingPage, LoginPage, Dashboard, ChapterDetail). Key files: App.tsx with protected routes, main.tsx entry point, and global styles. Database schema includes chapters, user_answers, progress, and user_profile tables.

a95805a4-8a6a-4d7b-a178-2a2eff49fba2.title: Database Schema and Architecture
a95805a4-8a6a-4d7b-a178-2a2eff49fba2.content:
# Database Schema and Architecture

# Database Schema and Architecture

Eventos Finais uses SQLite WASM with Web Worker for offline-first data storage and management.

## Database Technology
- **SQLite WASM**: In-browser database with full SQL support
- **Web Worker**: Non-blocking database operations
- **OPFS Storage**: Persistent file system storage when available
- **Fallback**: Transient storage for older browsers

## Core Tables

### chapters
```sql
CREATE TABLE chapters (
  id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
  title TEXT NOT NULL,
  summary TEXT,
  content TEXT,
  audio_url TEXT,
  order_index INTEGER,
  created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
  updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP
);
```

### questions
```sql
CREATE TABLE questions (
  id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
  chapter_id INTEGER NOT NULL,
  text TEXT NOT NULL,
  order_index INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
  created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
  FOREIGN KEY (chapter_id) REFERENCES chapters(id) ON DELETE CASCADE
);
```

### user_answers
```sql
CREATE TABLE user_answers (
  chapter_id INTEGER,
  question_id INTEGER,
  answer TEXT,
  updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
  synced INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
  PRIMARY KEY (chapter_id, question_id),
  FOREIGN KEY (chapter_id) REFERENCES chapters(id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
  FOREIGN KEY (question_id) REFERENCES questions(id) ON DELETE CASCADE
);
```

### progress
```sql
CREATE TABLE progress (
  chapter_id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
  is_read INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
  audio_progress REAL DEFAULT 0,
  FOREIGN KEY (chapter_id) REFERENCES chapters(id) ON DELETE CASCADE
);
```

### user_profile
```sql
CREATE TABLE user_profile (
  id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY CHECK (id = 1),
  username TEXT,
  email TEXT,
  is_verified INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
  is_admin INTEGER DEFAULT 0
);
```

## Architecture Pattern
- **DBService**: Facade pattern for database operations
- **Web Worker**: Isolates database operations from main thread
- **AdminService**: Business logic for content management
- **Sync Manager**: Handles offline/online synchronization

## Performance Optimizations
- Database operations in Web Worker prevent UI blocking
- Foreign key constraints ensure data integrity
- Indexes on frequently queried columns
- Transaction support for complex operations

## Data Flow
1. User interactions trigger service calls
2. Services use DBService facade
3. DBService communicates with Web Worker
4. Web Worker executes SQL operations
5. Results flow back through service layer
6. UI updates with new data

c0d687cb-16ad-49ed-96e2-6355fd4e49a1.title: Environment Configuration
c0d687cb-16ad-49ed-96e2-6355fd4e49a1.content:
# Environment Configuration

# Environment Configuration

Eventos Finais project environment variables and configuration settings.

## Kinde Authentication Variables
```
VITE_KINDE_DOMAIN=https://jaxreset.kinde.com
VITE_KINDE_CLIENT_ID=6647f2c41f7c4b0bbe56c2242d90e9da
VITE_KINDE_REDIRECT_URL=http://localhost:5173/dashboard
VITE_KINDE_LOGOUT_URL=http://localhost:5173/login
VITE_KINDE_APPLE_CONNECTION_ID=conn_019b8c0b2637311b997055dfa22adaf9
VITE_KINDE_FACEBOOK_CONNECTION_ID=conn_019b8c0b2637b613de285fc350e2051d
VITE_KINDE_GOOGLE_CONNECTION_ID=conn_019b8c0b26306780ce6501bc623e2625
VITE_KINDE_EMAIL_CODE_CONNECTION_ID=conn_019b806e77391f2348541bc65beec9ca
```

## Memory Configuration
```json
{
  "memoryDir": ".context/memory",
  "enabled": true,
  "description": "Eventos Finais project memory"
}
```

## Development Environment
- **Framework**: Vite with React 19 and TypeScript
- **Build Tool**: Vite (Rolldown for faster builds)
- **Package Manager**: npm
- **Browser Target**: Modern browsers with ES2020+ support

## PWA Configuration
- **Service Worker**: Enabled via Vite PWA plugin
- **Offline Support**: Full offline functionality
- **Install Prompt**: Custom install experience
- **Cache Strategy**: Network-first for critical assets

## Security Considerations
- All Kinde credentials stored in environment variables
- No hardcoded secrets in source code
- Role-based access control via Kinde
- HTTPS required for production deployment

## Database Configuration
- **SQLite WASM**: In-browser database
- **Storage**: OPFS (Origin Private File System) when available
- **Fallback**: In-memory storage for older browsers
- **Worker**: Database operations in separate thread

## Development Notes
- Use `.env.local` for local development overrides
- Environment variables must be prefixed with `VITE_` for client-side access
- Kinde dashboard configuration required for OAuth connections
- Memory system configured to use `.context/memory` directory

031e96e6-e403-4722-a39d-e3d29e197e95.title: Kinde SSO Implementation
031e96e6-e403-4722-a39d-e3d29e197e95.content:
# Kinde SSO Implementation

# Kinde SSO Implementation

Successfully implemented Kinde OAuth authentication with social providers for Eventos Finais project.

## Problem Solved
Fixed Apple SSO double sign-up issue where users were redirected to Kinde's registration page instead of going directly to the app dashboard.

## Solution Implemented
1. **Code Changes**: Updated LoginPage.tsx to use `register` method with `connectionId` parameter
2. **Kinde Configuration**: Enabled "Trust email addresses provided by this connection" in Apple connection settings
3. **Custom Auth Pages**: Configured Kinde to use custom authentication screens

## Key Files Modified
- `src/pages/LoginPage.tsx` - Updated signInWith function to use register method
- `.env` - Contains Kinde connection IDs for Apple, Google, Facebook
- Kinde dashboard - Apple connection settings updated

## Authentication Flow
1. User clicks Apple/Google/Facebook login button
2. Direct redirect to social provider OAuth (no Kinde intermediate screens)
3. Provider authenticates user
4. Kinde creates account automatically (if first-time)
5. Redirect to app dashboard

## Environment Variables
```
VITE_KINDE_DOMAIN=https://jaxreset.kinde.com
VITE_KINDE_CLIENT_ID=6647f2c41f7c4b0bbe56c2242d90e9da
VITE_KINDE_REDIRECT_URL=http://localhost:5173/dashboard
VITE_KINDE_APPLE_CONNECTION_ID=conn_019b8c0b2637311b997055dfa22adaf9
VITE_KINDE_FACEBOOK_CONNECTION_ID=conn_019b8c0b2637b613de285fc350e2051d
VITE_KINDE_GOOGLE_CONNECTION_ID=conn_019b8c0b26306780ce6501bc623e2625
```

## Best Practices Applied
- Used Kinde SDK v5 API with proper parameter structure
- Implemented device-specific Apple button visibility
- Enabled email trust for seamless social sign-up
- Custom authentication pages for better UX

044c3402-3612-487a-86ec-3d1181b33024.title: Kinde Role-Based Admin Authorization
044c3402-3612-487a-86ec-3d1181b33024.content:
# Kinde Role-Based Admin Authorization

# Kinde Role-Based Admin Authorization

Implemented role-based access control using Kinde's built-in role and permission system for admin dashboard access.

## Implementation Details

### Permission System
- Uses Kinde's `getPermissions()` API to check user roles
- Checks for `admin:access` permission key
- Real-time permission validation on each login

### Code Changes
Updated `src/contexts/AuthContext.tsx`:
```typescript
// Check if user has admin role from Kinde
const permissions = await getPermissions();
const isAdmin = permissions.permissions.some((perm: any) => 
  perm.key === 'admin:access' && perm.isGranted
);
```

### Kinde Setup Required
1. **Create Admin Role**: 
   - Name: `Admin`
   - Key: `admin`
2. **Create Permission**:
   - Name: `Admin Access`
   - Key: `admin:access`
3. **Assign Role**: Grant Admin role to authorized users

### Benefits
- Centralized role management in Kinde dashboard
- No hardcoded admin emails in source code
- Real-time updates (changes take effect on next login)
- Scalable for additional roles (Editor, Moderator, etc.)
- Audit trail through Kinde

### Security Features
- Protected route: `/admin` only accessible to users with admin permission
- Automatic redirect to `/dashboard` for non-admin users
- Permission caching in local database for offline scenarios

### Setup Guide
Complete setup instructions available in project documentation covering:
- Role creation in Kinde dashboard
- Permission configuration
- User assignment methods
- Troubleshooting common issues

This approach provides a professional, maintainable, and secure admin authorization system.

093b8e9f-c934-4bc3-8464-666ca9ace9ba.title: Admin Dashboard Implementation
093b8e9f-c934-4bc3-8464-666ca9ace9ba.content:
# Admin Dashboard Implementation

# Admin Dashboard Implementation

Complete admin interface for managing Eventos Finais content including chapters, audio files, and study questions.

## Features Implemented

### Chapter Management
- Create, edit, delete chapters
- Rich text editing for titles, summaries, and content
- Audio file upload with preview
- Chapter ordering and organization

### Question Management
- Add/remove study questions per chapter
- Question reordering functionality
- Real-time question editing

### User Interface
- Modern glassmorphism design matching app theme
- Responsive layout for all devices
- Smooth animations with Framer Motion
- Intuitive drag-and-drop interactions

### Technical Implementation
- **Database**: Updated schema with proper foreign key relationships
- **Service Layer**: AdminService for CRUD operations
- **File Upload**: Base64 encoding for audio files
- **Route Protection**: AdminRoute component with role-based access

## Key Files Created
- `src/pages/AdminDashboard.tsx` - Main admin interface
- `src/services/admin-service.ts` - Business logic for admin operations
- `src/components/AdminRoute.tsx` - Protected route component
- `src/utils/admin-manager.ts` - Admin management utilities

## Database Schema Updates
```sql
-- Added to chapters table
summary TEXT,
created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
updated_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP

-- New questions table
CREATE TABLE questions (
  id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY,
  chapter_id INTEGER NOT NULL,
  text TEXT NOT NULL,
  order_index INTEGER DEFAULT 0,
  created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
  FOREIGN KEY (chapter_id) REFERENCES chapters(id) ON DELETE CASCADE
);

-- Added to user_profile table
is_admin INTEGER DEFAULT 0
```

## Access Control
- Role-based authorization using Kinde permissions
- Admin access requires `admin:access` permission
- Automatic redirect for non-admin users
- Real-time permission checking on login

## Usage
1. Navigate to `/admin` (requires admin role)
2. Create new chapters with audio and content
3. Add study questions for each chapter
4. Manage existing chapters and questions
5. Upload and manage audio files
